intro: Mabea standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Mabea standleyi is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated for its beauty and ecological benefits.
